repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body:
setup.py has

```
"Programming Language :: Python :: Implementation :: Stackless",
```

and

```
"Programming Language :: Python :: 3.8",
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -172,32 +166,21 @@ jobs:
             extra_hash: "-limited_api"
           # Type specs
           - os: ubuntu-22.04
-            python-version: "3.12"
+            python-version: "3.14"
             backend: c
             env: { EXTRA_CFLAGS: "-DCYTHON_USE_TYPE_SPECS=1" }
             extra_hash: "-typespecs"
           - os: ubuntu-22.04
-            python-version: "3.9"
+            python-version: "3.12"
             backend: c
             env: { EXTRA_CFLAGS: "-DCYTHON_USE_TYPE_SPECS=1" }
             extra_hash: "-typespecs"
           - os: ubuntu-22.04
-            python-version: "3.8"
+            python-version: "3.9"
             backend: c
             env: { EXTRA_CFLAGS: "-DCYTHON_USE_TYPE_SPECS=1" }
             extra_hash: "-typespecs"
-          # Stackless

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    minimum Python version you want to support (\>=3.9).  ``0x03090000`` will support
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1347,8 +1347,8 @@ most important to least important:
     can be used by many Python interpreter versions (at the cost of some performance).
     At this stage many features do not work in the Limited API.  You should set this
     macro to be the version hex for the
-    minimum Python version you want to support (\>=3.8).  ``0x03080000`` will support
-    Python 3.8 upwards.
+    minimum Python version you want to support (\>=3.8).  ``0x03090000`` will support

comment_data.body: I was thinking about this. The documentation will probably also be read by users of Cython 3.1, so I didn't want to update the reference right away.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1347,8 +1347,8 @@ most important to least important:
     can be used by many Python interpreter versions (at the cost of some performance).
     At this stage many features do not work in the Limited API.  You should set this
     macro to be the version hex for the
-    minimum Python version you want to support (\>=3.8).  ``0x03080000`` will support
-    Python 3.8 upwards.
+    minimum Python version you want to support (\>=3.8).  ``0x03090000`` will support

comment_data.body:
These tests were trying to test `Py_LIMITED_API=0x03080000` which won't work now (and was crashing), so I've pushed a commit to drop that.

That does suggest we should also add an error on a too low Limited API versions too. I'll do a new PR for that though
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -31,7 +31,7 @@ modules = [
     "limited_multi_phase"
 ]
 
-for version in range(8, sys.version_info[1]+1):
+for version in range(9, sys.version_info[1]+1):

commit.message: Build: Fix some more references to Py3.8 in setup.py.
Update several minor bits and pieces in tests and documentation.

commit.message: Remove references to Stackless Python (stuck at Py3.8 and now unsupported).
Run isolated Limited tests from 3.9 upwards
Looks like PyPy 3.10 still needs cryptography/nh3 installed for twine to work.
Try to make test work in PyPy again.
